From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From hoja (“leaf”) +‎ -ear.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /oxeˈaɾ/ [o.xeˈaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: ho‧je‧ar
  • Homophone: ojear

Verb

[edit]

hojear (first-person singular present hojeo, first-person singular preterite hojeé, past participle hojeado)

  1. to page or leaf through; to skim

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
